Cell¶

mod

biosim.cell provides the user with the information stored in the different landscape cells at Rossumøya.

Rossumøya is divided into squares (or cells), where each square has its own location and is of one of the following five geography types: ocean, jungle, savannah, desert or mountain. The superclass and subclasses in this script holds all the information that are stored in all the landscape cells.

This file can be imported as a module and contains the following classes:

  • BaseCell - Superclass with the basic characteristics that all of the cell types in Rossumøya has in common.

  • Savannah(BaseCell) - Subclass of BaseCell with characteristics for the cell type Savannah.

  • Jungle(BaseCell) - Subclass of BaseCell with characteristics for the cell type Jungle.

  • Desert(BaseCell) - Subclass of BaseCell with characteristics for the cell type Desert.

  • Mountain(BaseCell) - Subclass of BaseCell with characteristics for the cell type Mountain.

  • Ocean(BaseCell) - Subclass of BaseCell with characteristics for the cell type Ocean.

Superclass for cell in BioSim.

Constructor that initiates class Cell.

Adds new animals in cell.

The total number of Herbivores in the cell.

Type

int

The total number of Carnivores in the cell.

Type

property fodder_in_cell¶

Fodder available in cell.

Setter

Sets the amount of fodder.

Type

float

property abundance_of_fodder_herbivores¶

Calculates the relative abundance of fodder for Herbivores according to the formula below.

\[\begin{equation} \epsilon_k = \frac{f_k}{(n_k + 1)F'} \end{equation}\]
\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} \mbox { where } F_k \mbox { is the amount of relevant fodder available in cell } k, \\ n_k \mbox { is the number of animals of the same species in cell } \\ k \mbox { and } F' \mbox { is the "appetite" of the species.} \end{equation}\end{split}\]
Type

float

property abundance_of_fodder_carnivores¶

Calculates the relative abundance of fodder for Carnivores according to the formula below.

\[\begin{equation} \epsilon_k = \frac{f_k}{(n_k + 1)F'} \end{equation}\]
\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} \mbox { where } F_k \mbox { is the amount of relevant fodder available in cell } k, \\ n_k \mbox { is the number of animals of the same species in cell } \\ k \mbox { and } F' \mbox { is the "appetite" of the species.} \end{equation}\end{split}\]
Type

float

fodder_first_year(f_max)[source]¶

Sets maximum fodder for Savannah and Jungle cells.

Parameters

f_max (float) – maximum fodder available in a cell type

regrow_fodder()[source]¶

Grow back initial fodder amount.

animals_age_and_lose_weight()[source]¶

Once a year all animals age and lose weight.

property list_of_sorted_herbivores_by_fitness¶

Sorts all Herbivores by fitness in descending order if there are more than one Herbivore in the cell.

type

list

property list_of_sorted_carnivores_by_fitness¶

Sorts all Carnivores by fitness in descending order if there are more than one Carnivore in the cell.

type

list

herbivores_eat()[source]¶

Herbivores eat in order of highest fitness. The Herbivore’s weight increases.

carnivores_eat()[source]¶

Carnivores eat in order of highest fitness. The Carnivore tries to kill the Herbivore with lowest fitness first. The Carnivore’s weight increases.

herb_procreation()[source]¶

Herbivores at the start of the breeding season procreate if the prob_procreation method returns 1.

carn_procreation()[source]¶

Carnivores at the start of the breeding season procreate if the prob_procreation method returns 1.

add_offspring(animal)[source]¶

Adds offspring to the cell, and decrease weight of the mother.

Parameters

animal (type) – Mother who gives birth

find_migrating_animals()[source]¶

Makes a list of the animals who wants to migrate out of the cell.

Returns

migrating_animals

Return type

list

reset_migration()[source]¶

Resets the has_migrated attribute to False for all animals in the cell.

property propensity_migration_herb¶

Calculates the propensity for a Herbivore to move from \(i \mbox { to } j \in C^{(i)}\) according to the formula given below.

\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} \pi_{i \rightarrow j} = \begin{cases} 0 & \mbox { if j is Mountain or Ocean} \\ e^{\lambda \epsilon_j} & \mbox { otherwise } \end{cases} \quad \end{equation}\end{split}\]
Type

float

property propensity_migration_carn¶

Calculates the propensity for a Carnivore to move from \(i \mbox { to } j \in C^{(i)}\) according to the formula given below.

\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} \pi_{i \rightarrow j} = \begin{cases} 0 & \mbox { if j is Mountain or Ocean} \\ e^{\lambda \epsilon_j} & \mbox { otherwise } \end{cases} \quad \end{equation}\end{split}\]
Type

float

remove_animals(gone_animals)[source]¶

Removes animal that has migrated.

Parameters

gone_animals (list) – list of animals that has migrated

add_animals(new_animals)[source]¶

Adds new animals to the animals list.

Parameters

new_animals (list) – List of new animals

class biosim.cell.Savannah[source]¶

Class instance of class Cell for the cell type Savannah.

Constructor that initiate class instance Savannah.

classmethod set_parameters(f_max=None, alpha=None)[source]¶

Set default parameters for class instance Savannah.

Parameters

  • f_max (float) – Maximum fodder available in cell type Savannah

  • alpha (float) – Constant

regrow_fodder()[source]¶

Calculates regrowth of fodder in cell type Savannah by using the formula below.

\[f_{ij} \leftarrow f_{ij} + \alpha \times (f^{Sav}_{max} - f_{ij})\]

property propensity_migration_herb¶

Sets the propensity for a Herbivore to migrate to zero, because Mountain cells are impassable.

property propensity_migration_carn¶

Sets the propensity for a Carnivore to migrate to zero, because Mountain cells are impassable.
